page.title: 11MID-SUSSEX EMPOLYMENT (3)
page.content: The{Rock Lodge Vineyard}started planting vines 21 yrs ago.It was one of the first eight in this country. They started by planting 50 different types in small batches to see which ones grew well in this country.The best was a German type and a separate one called Racansteiner.Each year the Rock Lodge spreads a little more. This Easter and last Easter they planted more than usual.They always like to have some competition.Many people say that you can't grow a red wine in England because of the lack of sun.It is the amount of hours the sun shines that counts.The average yield per acre is 3500 to 4000 bottles a year.This is aproximately 1000 bottles every ton of grapes.Last year they produced 16000 bottles-16 tons.
